display_asset.caption: Police officers placed tape around a damaged building in Illapel, Chile, on Thursday, a day after an earthquake hit the country.

summaries.body: The earthquake that struck off Chile on Wednesday was strong, but the reported death toll has been much lower than a 2010 earthquake and tsunami that killed hundreds.
Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, who disappeared from his outpost in Afghanistan in 2009, had a “severe mental disease or defect,” one of his lawyers said during a hearing.
NASA's New Horizons spacecraft took this picture of the craggy mountains and icy plains of Pluto in July. The space agency is releasing new photos every Thursday.
Milo Hamilton, a longtime Major League Baseball broadcaster who called Henry Aaron's record-breaking 715th home run in 1974, has died at 88.
Even as Chinese officials have feted award-winning science fiction writers this week, they have cracked down on Internet hucksters who write of zombies and aliens.
Mozambique declared itself free of landmines after two decades of work to rid the country of a legacy of war that killed or maimed thousands, many of them civilians.
MSNBC’s shift to more hard news coverage during the day is coming into focus in advance of Brian Williams’s return next week.
Egypt has banned news coverage of the accidental killings of a group of Mexican tourists in the White Desert over the weekend.

posts.footer: The Associated Press | The New York Times

summaries.body: Yunis Abdurrahman Shokuri, a Moroccan terrorism suspect, has been released after nearly 14 years at Guantánamo Bay, the Pentagon said Thursday.
The National Book Foundation announced 10 nominees for the National Book Award for fiction, including the novelists Hanya Yanagihara, Nell Zink and Lauren Groff.
Swiss authorities approved the extradition of a Uruguayan citizen, Eugenio Figueredo, to the U.S. as part of an investigation into corruption in soccer.

display_asset.caption: Amazon is offering its Fire TV set-top box with a game controller for $140.

summaries.body: Amazon, hoping to dominate in the living room with the same strategy it used for the e-books business, introduced new versions of Fire TV products without raising prices.

display_asset.caption: An opposition lawmaker, Yukihiro Knishi, top, was punched by a governing party politician, Masahisa Sato, second from right, in Japan’s Parliament on Thursday.

summaries.body: Legislators scuffled and demonstrators took to the streets as Japan’s governing coalition tried to secure final passage of legislation that would loosen limits on the military.

display_asset.caption: Matthew Lopez, 33, examines marijuana buds with his iPhone light while shopping with his fiancé Lizette Ortiz, 26, at The Grass Station in Denver, Co.
display_asset.credit: Benjamin Rasmussen for The New York Times

summaries.body: Because of a quirk in the state Constitution, marijuana products in Colorado were nearly tax free on Wednesday. “I’ve been saying ‘Happy holidays’ to everybody today," one buyer said.
A coalition proposed setting aside special zones in Times Square for the topless painted women, costumed characters and other cash solicitors who gather in the area.
Guards seized Burkina Faso’s interim president, prime minister and two cabinet ministers, in what appeared to be a military coup attempt. Above, protesters gathered.
New York State planned to trim Common Core exams after many students skipped them.
Two Russian pranksters said they had called Elton John impersonating President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia. The leader's spokesman said they owed the singer an apology.

display_asset.caption: Residents watch rescuers search along the Short Creek after a flash flood in Hildale, Utah on September 15.

summaries.body: The 12 people killed in a flash flood in southern Utah were three sisters and their children, officials said. Searchers were looking for a 6-year-old boy who was still missing.
The Justice Department said it won't challenge the travel site Expedia's $1.3 billion purchase of Orbitz, a competitor, saying the deal is unlikely to hurt consumers.

display_asset.credit: Bryan R. Smith for The New York Times

summaries.body: Lyft, the ride-hailing start-up, announced a partnership with Didi Kuaidi, a Chinese ride company, that will allow it to operate in China for the first time.

posts.footer: President Obama, via Twitter. A high school student in Texas, Ahmed Mohamed, was accused of a bomb hoax and detained after he brought a homemade clock to school.

summaries.body: Cool clock, Ahmed. Want to bring it to the White House? We should inspire more kids like you to like science. It's what makes America great.
BREAKING: Secretary of State Kerry says Russia has proposed military-to-military talks with US on Syria
Our reporters take you to the final packed days of New York Fashion Week, with Amy Schumer, Michael Kors, Kanye West and so much more!

display_asset.caption: The note left by Shannon S. Lamb, who is suspected of killing his girlfriend, Amy Prentiss, and Ethan A. Schmidt, an educator at Delta State University.

summaries.body: The police are still seeking a motive in this week's Delta State University murder-suicide, but they have released a note left by the suspect.

display_asset.caption: Jeremy Corbyn, the new leader of Britain's opposition Labour Party, during his first Prime Minister's Question Time in the House of Commons in London on Wednesday.

summaries.body: Jeremy Corbyn crowd-sourced questions for the British prime minister in his first Question Time as the leader of the opposition Labour Party.

Almost 2.8 billion people live in countries where identifying as gay can lead to jail or death. The photographer Robin Hammond traveled to seven countries to make portraits of some attacked for being gay, bisexual or transgender.

posts.footer: Vedphoto.com, via The New York Times

display_asset.caption: In June 2013, members of the Grand Canyon Stratospheric Balloon Team and vedphoto.com launched a balloon with a camera into the stratosphere. The camera was found by a hiker two years later.
display_asset.title: The GoPro That Fell to Earth

summaries.body: Breathtaking footage of the Grand Canyon was retrieved from a GoPro attached to a balloon two years after it crashed in the desert.
With the deadline having passed, five cities are officially candidates for the 2024 Olympics: Los Angeles, Paris, Rome, Budapest and Hamburg, Germany.
Mason Darrow, an offensive lineman at Princeton, said he is gay. He is believed to be the only openly gay player in major college football.
